elements.label: Memory: Feast after victory
elements.description: They enjoyed grilled lamb and mulled wine. The soldier receives the most toasts. Their cheeks getting redder each time.

elements.label: Memory: Feast with friends
elements.description: They enjoyed mushroom pasties and fried fish. Afterwards, most of them stayed to play cards. The grey-eyed scribe won the most.

elements.label: Memory: First arrival in the fort
elements.description: The knight remembers their first arrival at the fort a year ago. They were treated very well by the baron and the scribe.

elements.label: Memory: Discussing tactics with friends
elements.description: The knight remembers that they had good friends in Shroudburn, who are now enemies.

elements.label: Memory: The importance of Bishop's tactics
elements.description: The knight realizes that the bishop has played such important parts in many of their victories.

elements.label: Memory: Dining with the Baron
elements.description: The Knight misses the time they spent at the fort with the Baron and the Scribe, who were lively and interesting company.

elements.label: Memory: Dining with the Scribe
elements.description: The Knight remembers that it was always awkward dining with the Scribe alone during their stay at the fort. They are still amazed that they became friends.

elements.label: Memory: Playing cards with the Baron and the Scribe
elements.description: Playing cards with the Baron and the Scribe was a common way of spending the evening during the Knightâ€™s previous stay at the fort. They still get a few laugh thinking about those times.

elements.label: Memory: Philosophical discussion with the Scribe
elements.description: The Scribe is the most peculiar person the Knight has ever met. They are very philosophical, yet they do not believe in God.
